channel.title: Religion related leaks
channel.description:
Everybody is hoping for leaks to come out about institutions they don't like. I got one of my wishes today involving my former religion, Catholicism.
[url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2010/dec/10/wikileaks-pope-turkey-eu-muslim] WikiLeaks cables: Pope wanted Muslim Turkey kept out of EU Vatican diplomats also lobbied against Venezuela's Hugo Chávez and wanted 'Christian roots' enshrined in EU constitution [/url] ^^ church ignoring that when Europe was ruled by Christianity, we called it the Dark Ages.
[url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2010/dec/10/wikileaks-pope-anglicans-catholics]WikiLeaks: Pope's offer to Anglicans risked 'violence against Catholics'[/url]
^^ Naked self-interest over protection of people, Who would've thought it?
[url=http://www.nytimes.com/2010/12/11/world/europe/11vatican.html?_r=2&emc=eta1][A cable] cited “an older desk officer of French origin” who complained that the United States government’s “strong interest in modern European anti-Semitism stemmed from the ‘excessive influence of Jews in your media and government,’ ” while another curial official said some lawsuits against the Holy See “were the result of ‘Jewish judges having too much influence.’ ” [/url]
^^ Nazi pope? no, cant be...

item.title: Religion related leaks
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Came across a leak regarding Isreal.

haaretz.com

WikiLeaks cable warns of 'widening crime war' in Israel

The cable is signed by Ambassador James Cunningham, but appears to have been written by the American consul in Tel Aviv as a note on visa restrictions for members of Israel's organized crime syndicate.

Read full topic

item.description:
@yakman wrote:

http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2010/dec/21/wikileaks-cables-vatican-holocaust-pius

The Church didn’t want to support a holocaust memorial because it would make Pope Pius XII, the pope during the second world war, look bad.

item.title: Religion related leaks
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“thepinksock, post:15, topic:372887”]I was 6 years old when I realized Catholicism is a load of bull.

There I was sitting cross-legged in assembly. It came to the point where our headmistress told us it was time to do our daily pray. I bowed my head and closed my eyes, as did everyone. That day I decided to peek out of my eye to get a look at god. I opened my eyes while everyone else had them closed. I saw no god, or spirit that I assumed must surround us when we pray. Instead I saw a bunch of sheep with their eyes closed spewing bullshit.

Shits crazy[/quote]

Dunno if you’re joking, but that’s pretty much how it was for me. I vividly remember sitting praying in assembly (CoE school, brrap) at like some stupidly young age feeling like an idiot because we were all sitting there talking to an imaginary guy.

Read full topic

That day I decided to peek out of my eye to get a look at god. I opened my eyes while everyone else had them closed. I saw no god, or spirit that I assumed must surround us when we pray. item.title: Religion related leaks
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

The best cure for Christianity is learning about it, I self consider myself a Christian until beginning of last school year (When I began on a Christian school). Then I realize how stupid I had been (I accepted evolution and that was the problem, I saw how it could not fit into the Bible).

Read full topic

item.title: Religion related leaks
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:11, topic:372887”][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=468913.msg3428941#msg3428941 date=1292171156]
I don’t think ANYONE is born into it, no one really follows a religion till they’re old enough to understand it.
[/quote]
I was born into Catholicism and followed it quite seriously until I was old enough to understand it’s a load of shit.[/quote]

But I’d say you didn’t really follow it then, because you didn’t understand it. Yeah, you’re told that you are a follower of this religion, but what does that really mean?

Read full topic
